summary: The 5.56×45mm NATO is a type of bullet created in the late 1970s by the company FN Herstal in Belgium. It's often called "5.56 NATO" and is used by many countries, including those in NATO. This bullet is based on the .223 Remington cartridge made by Remington Arms. On October 28, 1980, it became the second official bullet type for NATO forces. The 5.56 NATO family includes SS109, L110, and SS111 cartridges.
title: 5.56×45mm NATO
